StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: NHLBI TOPMed: Chicago Initiative to Raise Asthma Health Equity (CHIRAH)

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS AT CHICAGOUNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The TOPMed acknowledgement statement can be found at: https://topmed.nhlbi.nih.gov/acknowledgements. Whole genome sequencing (WGS) for the Trans-Omics in Precision Medicine (TOPMed) program was supported by the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute (NHLBI). WGS for TOPMed NHLBI TOPMed: Chicago Initiative to Raise Asthma Health Equity (CHIRAH) was performed at University of Washington Northwest Genomics Center (HHSN268201100037C). Centralized read mapping and genotype calling, along with variant quality metrics and filtering were provided by the TOPMed Informatics Research Center (3R01HL-117626-02S1). Phenotype harmonization, data management, sample-identity QC, and general study coordination, were provided by the TOPMed Data Coordinating Center (3R01HL-120393-02S1). We gratefully acknowledge the studies and participants who provided biological samples and data for TOPMed. The CHIRAH study team.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the data must be related to Asthma.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Asthma, IRB, COL)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-ASTHMA-IRB-COL
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Asthma. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s).
Use of the data must be related to Asthma. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Only full or expedited IRB are acceptable and this study requires IRB annual review. Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s).

ConsentGroup.title: Exchange Area
ConsentGroup.name: EA
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Asthma. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Only full or expedited IRB are acceptable and this study requires IRB annual review. Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s). Use by TOPMed WGS Exchange Area investigators only.
